=Building the EscTool=

==On Ubuntu Linux==
 # Install build-essential
  * {{{sudo apt-get install build-essential}}}
 # Install Qt
  * {{{sudo apt-get install libqt4-dev}}}
 # Optionally install qt-creator for developing on this project.
  * {{{sudo apt-get install qt-creator}}}
 # Download the Code and open a console. Switch to the code-directory
  * {{{qmake && make}}}
 # you can execute the EscTool by typing:
  * ./escdude

=Building the firmware=

==On Ubuntu Linux=
 # Install the build chain
  * {{{sudo apt-get install avr-libc binutils-avr gcc-avr avrdude}}}
 # Download the Code and open a console. Switch to the code-subdirectory firmware
  * {{{./build}}}
  * edit upload file ... replace /dev/ttyACM0 with the port which your Arduino uses
  * {{{./upload}}}
